definition-item.definition-title: Controlling the engine output power by varying inlet or exhaust valve operating characteristics, e.g. timing

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Controlling the engine output power by varying inlet or exhaust valve operating characteristics, e.g. timing. The inlet and exhaust valves within an internal combustion engine are used to control the flow of the intake and exhaust gases into and out of the combustion chamber. The timing, duration and lift of these valve has a significant impact on engine performance. In a standard engine, the valve events are fixed, so performance at different loads and speeds is always a compromise between driveability, e.g. power and torque, fuel economy and emissions. An engine equipped with a variable valve actuation system is freed from this constraint, allowing performance to be improved over the engine operating range.

definition-item.definition-title: Controlling engines by cutting out individual cylinders; Rendering engines inoperative or idling (controlling or rendering inoperative by varying inlet or exhaust valve operating characteristics F02D13/00)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Controlling engines by cutting out individual cylinders; Rendering engines inoperative or idling. Cylinder deactivation is used to reduce the fuel consumption and emissions of an internal combustion engine during light-load operation. In typical light-load driving the driver uses only around 30 percent of an engine's maximum power. In these conditions the throttle valve is nearly closed and the engine needs to work to draw air. This causes an inefficiency known as pumping loss. Some large capacity engines need to be throttled so much at light load that the cylinder pressure at top dead centre is approximately half that of a small 4-cylinder engine. Low cylinder pressure means low fuel efficiency. The use of cylinder deactivation at light load means there are fewer cylinders drawing air from the intake manifold, which works to increase its air pressure. Operation without variable displacement is wasteful because fuel is continuously pumped into each cylinder and combusted even though maximum performance is not required.

Starting engines: F02N11/00.

definition-item.definition-title: Programme-control of engines

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Programme-control of engines. Although operator control is suitable for automobile engines, there are many systems, such as standby emergency electric power systems, where this type of control is impractical and expensive. For these applications, automatic program control systems have been devised which perform necessary engine control functions without operator attendance. Programme-control is also used in remote starting systems for automobile engines for example heating up the passenger cabin.

Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: {for control of turbo-charged or super-charged engines (control of the pumps per se F02B37/12)}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Mechanical control of turbocharged injected engine
Control of turbochargers and superchargers per se

definition-item.definition-title: {Controlling engines characterised by use of non-liquid fuels, pluralities of fuels, or non-fuel substances added to the combustible mixtures}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Controlling engines running with:

list-item.paragraph-text: non-liquid fuels- multiple fuels, e.g. different octane rates, alcohol + gasoline- additives added to the fuel/air (for catalyst, for enhancing burning (pure O2, N2O), etc)- alcohol, methanol and problems linked to the fuel quality/property

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Control using fuel type or fuel quality sensor
Control using fuel type or fuel quality estimation

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: {Adding fuel vapours, e.g. drawn from engine fuel reservoir}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Control of the supply of fuel vapours which are normally drawn from a canister which adsorbs fuel vapours generated in the fuel tank
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: System arrangements for fuel vapour purging

definition-item.definition-title: {Controlling the purging of the canister as a function of the engine operating conditions}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Engine conditions are taken into account and purging is controlled

definition-item.definition-title: {to achieve a special effect, e.g. to warm up the catalyst}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Purging is used for a particular effect on the engine, e.g. to warm-up catalyst

definition-item.definition-title: {for diagnosing the engine (diagnosis of purge control systems F02M25/0809)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Control of purging to achieve conditions which are suitable for engine Diagnosis. - If the expected effect due to purging does not occur, failure is determined- Switch off of purging to prevent influence on diagnosis
This place does not cover:

definition-item.definition-title: {Control of the valve or purge actuator, e.g. duty cycle, closed loop control of position}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Details specific to the control of the purge valve itself

definition-item.definition-title: {Controlling the combustible mixture as a function of the canister purging, e.g. control of injected fuel to compensate for deviation of air fuel ratio when purging}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Control of the engine mixture is adapted to purging taking place

definition-item.definition-title: {Estimating, calculating or determining the purging rate, amount, flow or concentration}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Details specific to the estimation, calculation or any kind of determination of the purge quantity

definition-item.definition-title: {Controlling exhaust gas recirculation [EGR] (temperature control with cooler in recirculation circuit F02M26/33)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Electrical control of exhaust gas recirculation (EGR)
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: {Feedback control of engine parameters, e.g. for control of air/fuel ratio or intake air amount}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Feedback control using EGR for all parameter not directly related to EGR. This might include:
intake amount amount
intake manifold pressure
air/fuel ratio
combustion timing
engine roughness
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Internal EGR rate or amount feedback
External EGR rate or amount feedback

section-body.paragraph-text: The feedback parameter should be classified in the corresponding groups as well

definition-item.definition-title: {Special engine operating conditions, e.g. for regeneration of exhaust gas treatment apparatus}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Special control of EGR for non-ordinary operating conditions, e.g.:

list-item.paragraph-text: engine diagnosis- during fuel cut- Exhaust catalyst regeneration

definition-item.definition-title: {Specific combustion modes (combustion modes per se F02D41/3017)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

EGR control according to or during engine operation with specific combustion modes, e.g. special engines with two EGR modes on both sides of the peak of smoke which appears when the EGR rate is increased in a diesel engine or HCCI without anything specific to EGR control
Feedback control of EGR to control combustion timing e.g. in HCCI mode; F02D41/0052
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: {using internal EGR (control of valve overlap for internal EGR F02D13/0261; arrangements for internal EGR F02M26/01)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Exhaust gases are redirected into the combustion chamber or kept as residual gases during positive or negative valve overlap
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: {Estimating, calculating or determining the internal EGR rate, amount or flow}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Determination of the EGR rate or residual gas amount remaining in the cylinder when internal EGR is used
Only as additional information if parameter is only mentioned without details on how to determine it

definition-item.definition-title: {Specific aspects of external EGR control (constructional details of EGR system F02M26/00)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
something specific to external EGR, e.g. considering transport delays or when using low pressure and high pressure EGR circuits

definition-item.definition-title: {Estimating, calculating or determining the EGR rate, amount or flow (sensors in EGR systems F02M26/45)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Determination of the EGR rate in external EGR circuits
Only as additional information if parameter is only mentioned without details on how to determine it

definition-item.definition-title: {Control of the EGR valve or actuator, e.g. duty cycle, closed loop control of position (EGR valve position sensor F02M26/48)}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: {Controlling each cylinder individually}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Operation of individual engine cylinders with different operating parameters, e.g. different fuel amounts or air amounts
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Cylinder individual control of ignition timing

section-body.paragraph-text: Multiple classification for the corresponding actuator(s) applies

definition-item.definition-title: {per groups or banks (F02D41/0087 takes precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Operation of cylinder groups with different operating parameters, e.g. first cylinder group operating lean and second cylinder group operating rich to achieve heating or regeneration of catalysts
This group is not used for deactivation of cylinder banks which should be classified in F02D41/0087 only

definition-item.definition-title: {Balancing of cylinder outputs, e.g. speed, torque or air-fuel ratio}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Control to equalise engine operating parameter for all cylinders

There might be some overlap with F02D41/1498, however F02D41/1498 covers at least measuring/detecting roughness per se, control according to roughness when all cylinders are controlled in the same way (e.g. idling/lean rough limit). If there is roughness detection and individual control then both groups should be used. Some overlap with engine roughness

definition-item.definition-title: {Selective cylinder activation, i.e. partial cylinder operation (deceleration cut-off F02D41/123)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Selective activation or deactivation of cylinders: every cylinder is fed with an optimal fuel quantity for an optimal combustion or with no fuel at all. The engine power also being controlled by the number of fed cylinders and not by the throttle and the air/fuel per cylinder.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Complete fuel-cut in all cylinders during deceleration

definition-item.definition-title: {using means for generating position or synchronisation signals}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Detection of engine crank angle position and generation of synchronisation signals, i.e. information about which cylinder is in which cycle (intake, compression, expansion or exhaust cycle).
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: {using means for generating speed signals}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Detection and measurement of engine speed.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Circuit arrangements for generating control signals

section-body.paragraph-text: This group should not be used.

definition-item.definition-title: {using an auxiliary engine speed control (engine speed control per se F02D31/00)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Generator, pump or PTO (e.g. agricultural Power Take Off) engines with an externally needed regulated speed control.
This place does not cover:

definition-item.definition-title: {Introducing corrections for particular conditions exterior to the engine (conjoint control of vehicle sub-units for propelling the vehicle B60W30/18)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Control according to particular conditions exterior to the engine, e.g.

list-item.paragraph-text: positional information from navigation systems
road conditions
engine control in relation with other vehicle sub-systems

section-body.paragraph-text: The conditions exterior to the engine should also be classified in F02D2200/70.

definition-item.definition-title: {in relation with elements of the transmission}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Control of the engine in relation with gearbox and/or clutch
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: More general aspects of driveline control, conjoint control of driveline elements

definition-item.definition-title: {in relation with the gear ratio shifting (conjoint control for improving gear change B60W30/19)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Special control during the gear shift. Usually torque or speed control to target values
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Conjoint control to improve gear change

definition-item.definition-title: {in relation with the state of the exhaust gas treating apparatus (control of exhaust gas treating apparatus per se F01N)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Control of engine in order to achieve specific effect on exhaust gas treatment device, e.g. regeneration or warming-up
Borderline between F02D41/0235 and F01N is defined based on where the intervention to achieve heating or regeneration takes place:

list-item.paragraph-text: F02D41/0235 if the engine control is affected
F01N if the control takes place in the exhaust, e.g. by injection into the exhaust pipe or electrical heating for catalysts

definition-item.definition-title: {to increase temperature of the exhaust gas treating apparatus}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Engine control to increase the temperature of an exhaust gas catalyst or filteralso given for regeneration, when method for temperature increase is important

definition-item.definition-title: {by increasing temperature of the exhaust gas leaving the engine}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Methods for raising catalyst temperature wherein additional heat is generated by combustion inside cylinder, e.g. by early post injection and delaying (main) injection timing.

definition-item.definition-title: {by changing the composition of the exhaust gas, e.g. for exothermic reaction on exhaust gas treating apparatus}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Methods for raising catalyst temperature wherein additional heat is generated in exhaust pipe or on catalyst, e.g. by late post injection with surplus of oxygen from same/other cylinder, or by driving cylinders with different air/fuel ratios so that exhaust gases from these cylinders mix in exhaust pipe.

definition-item.definition-title: {to purge or regenerate the exhaust gas treating apparatus}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Engine control without special control according to the type of catalyst

definition-item.definition-title: {the exhaust gas treating apparatus being a NOx trap or adsorbent}

section-body.paragraph-text: Parameters characterising the state of the exhaust gas treating apparatus should be classified in F02D2200/08 as well. F02D2200/0806-F02D2200/0811 are of particular importance for NOx traps.

definition-item.definition-title: {Desulfurisation of NOx traps or adsorbent}

section-body.paragraph-text: Parameters characterising the state of the exhaust gas treating apparatus should be classified in F02D2200/08 as well. F02D2200/0818 is of particular importance for the desulfurisation of NOx traps.

definition-item.definition-title: {the exhaust gas treating apparatus being a particulate filter}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Regenerating particle filter with means in exhaust;

section-body.paragraph-text: Parameters characterising the state of the exhaust gas treating apparatus should be classified in F02D2200/08 as well. F02D2200/0812 is of particular importance for the regeneration of particle filters.

definition-item.definition-title: {Control according to the amount of oxygen that is stored on the exhaust gas treating apparatus}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Control of engine air/fuel ratio so that amount of oxygen that is stored on (three-way)-catalyst with oxygen storage capacity meets target value.
Parameters characterising the state of the exhaust gas treating apparatus should be classified in F02D2200/08 as well. F02D2200/0814 and F02D2200/0816 are of particular importance for this group.

definition-item.definition-title: {for stopping the engine}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Control for stopping the engine or during the engine stopping period
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: {Taking into account fuel evaporation or wall wetting; (special correction after fuel cut-off F02D41/126)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Control combining partial pressures of vapour fuel, fresh air, recycled exhaust gas, less deposited fuel to calculate real air/fuel ratio taken in each cylinder
Control using models to determine fuel film on intake and cylinder walls

definition-item.definition-title: for engine starting or warming up {(F02D41/0255 takes precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Corrections during engine start or warm-up.

definition-item.definition-title: {the corrections being time dependent}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Corrections during engine start linked to a delay or timer.

definition-item.definition-title: {for starting (F02D41/061 takes precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Corrections during engine start.

definition-item.definition-title: {at cold start (F02D41/067 takes precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Engine control during engine start when engine is cold, e.g. increase of fuel injection amount to compensate increased fuel demand.

definition-item.definition-title: {at hot start or restart (F02D41/067 takes precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Engine start when engine is warm or immediate restart, e.g. after stall or during engine start/stop control

definition-item.definition-title: {with control of the choke (non electronic control of choke see F02M1/10)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Purely electrical chokes as well as mechanical automatic chokes where the bimetallic spiral or wax actuator is electrically heated when the engine has started.

definition-item.definition-title: {for warming-up}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Warming-up measures, e.g. fast idle to accelerate warming-up

definition-item.definition-title: for idling (F02D41/06, F02D41/16 take precedence)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Engine control during idling
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: {taking into account engine load variation, e.g. air-conditionning}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Engine control during idling considering external loads, e.g.

list-item.paragraph-text: air condition
generators
power steering

definition-item.definition-title: for acceleration

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Engine control during acceleration, e.g. increase of fuel injection amount to meet increased demand.

definition-item.definition-title: {Switching from sequential injection to simultaneous injection}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Increase of the number of injectors in intake low pressure injection to increase fuel flow

definition-item.definition-title: {using asynchronous injection}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Control with extra fuel pulse at start of acceleration in addition to ordinary fuel pulses which are sequentially injected at regular intervals

definition-item.definition-title: {the fuel injection being cut-off}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
The fuel being cut off in all cylinders during deceleration as long as there is no serious reason to restart.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Selective activation/deactivation of some, but not all cylinders

definition-item.definition-title: {transitional corrections at the end of the cut-off period}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

When the engine is decelerating it is necessary to restart the engine before idle speed is reached to avoid stalling if injection is restarted too late. Transitional measures may also be taken before. Special control to bring back catalyst to normal working range

definition-item.definition-title: {characterised by the control or regulation method (F02D41/1473, F02D41/1477 take precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Documents giving details on the feedback loop should be put in this group and groups when it is not a PID or some basic controller, then prefer to classify in F02D41/1473 and F02D41/1477
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:
Classifiy as well according to what is controlled or what is measured., e.g. F02D41/1438, F02D41/16

definition-item.definition-title: {Adaptive control}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
The parameters/coefficients of the controller are set/tuned on-line according to the output of the system (there must be a feedback). Also called Self-Tuning regulator.

Not to be confused with "learning" where some values are stored to be re-used. This should be classified in F02D41/2429. A controller having different coefficients stored in a table and where the coefficients are chosen according to operating conditions should be classified in F02D2041/1422.

definition-item.definition-title: {Dithering techniques}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Dithering for learning in air/fuel ratio control

definition-item.definition-title: {using means for determining characteristics of the combustion gases; Sensors therefor}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Control according to a characteristic of the combustion gases.

definition-item.definition-title: {Sensor in intake manifold}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Use of a gas concentration sensor in the intake manifold, e.g. to measure the O2/fuel ratio before the mixture enters the combustion chambers on order to avoid the two-revolutions delay.

definition-item.definition-title: {Plural sensors}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Multiple sensor arrangements in the exhaust system, e.g. one sensor before the catalyst converter and one after to check its functioning
Downstream sensor might be used for tuning the air/fuel ratio loop based on the upstream sensor

definition-item.definition-title: {with one sensor per cylinder or group of cylinders}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
A sensor is provided for each cylinder group or bank, e.g.in the case of V- or flat engines for example

definition-item.definition-title: {characterised by the characteristics of the combustion gases}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: {the sensor being an optical sensor}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Use of an optical sensor in the exhaust system, e.g. for smoke measurements by evaluating the color/transparency of the exhaust gases.
This place does not cover:

definition-item.definition-title: {Regulating the air fuel ratio at a value other than stoichiometry}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Engine control to achieve an air-fuel ratio deviating from the stoichiometric air/fuel ratio, e.g. by:

list-item.paragraph-text: shifting the comparator level- having different rising and descending slopes for the integral or the proportional part of the control- using a linear sensor

definition-item.definition-title: {Biasing of the sensor}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Two-states sensors wherein a flow of O2 ions across the porous sensor is simulated by simply sending electrons

definition-item.definition-title: {characterised by the regulation circuit or part of it,(e.g. comparator, PI regulator, output)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Air/fuel ratio control circuits and its components

definition-item.definition-title: {Using a comparator with variable reference}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Air/fuel ratio control with two-state air/fuel ratio sensor wherein the air/fuel ratio sensor signal is compared with a variable reference to have a lambda regulation value different from 1
Adaptation of the comparator value to variation of sensor characteristics, e.g. with temperature or age

definition-item.definition-title: {Using a plurality of comparators}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Air/fuel ratio control using a plurality of comparators, e.g. by selecting among them according to circumstances, to have a lambda regulation value different from 1.

definition-item.definition-title: {Using a delaying circuit}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Control related to the problem caused by the delay between the fuel injection and the sensing of exhaust gas properties due to travel in intake, compression, expansion, exhaust and travel in exhaust. To reduce the generated oscillation in steady some delays are introduced in the regulation loop.

definition-item.definition-title: {with correction for particular operating conditions}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Air/fuel ratio control during particular operating conditions, e.g. during transient conditions.

definition-item.definition-title: {Inhibiting the regulation}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Deactivation of air/fuel control based on exhaust sensor measurements, e.g. during transitions

definition-item.definition-title: {Details}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Constructional details of the air/fuel control circuit or its componentsAir/fuel ratio sensor input circuits

definition-item.definition-title: {Control of sensor heater}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Control of heating of an exhaust gas sensor to its operating temperature

definition-item.definition-title: {Detection of abnormalities in the air/fuel ratio feedback system}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Detection of abnormalities in the air/fuel ratio feedback system, especially air/fuel ratio sensor failure detection, e.g. by checking its temperature, its resistivity, its speed of reaction or its output voltage range.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: {With detection of the mechanical response of the engine}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Control using demanded and measured torque, power etc...

definition-item.definition-title: {measuring engine roughness}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Detection of roughness caused by misfires due to insufficient fuel in the cylinder or due to a too late ignition not able to reach the fuel cloud. Misfire is a lack of combustion. Detection of roughness caused by different contributions of individual cylinders

definition-item.definition-title: by measuring intake air flow

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Direct air mass measurement
Three types of sensors:

list-item.paragraph-text: air flaps normally classified here, with a plate pushed away by air dynamic pressure, which moves a potentiometer giving a resistance or a voltage proportionnal to air flow,
vortex (Karmann) flowmeters which give a frequency directly proportionnal to the mass of air flowing in the pipe see F02D41/185
hot wires using a wire which resistance varies with temperature, and which is heated by electric current and cooled by the air passing on it: they also give a voltage, see F02D41/187.

section-body.paragraph-text: Computed air flow after manifold depression or throttle opening may also be here with the keyword "parameter measurement - air model"

There are two schools of injection control: the density based injection where an intake vacuum was combined with rpm after eventual temperature correction and the air-mass based injection where a direct air mass flow measure is used.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Output circuits, e.g. for controlling currents in command coils

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Circuits for driving injection valves but also gas exchange valves in engines
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Current control in inductive loads in general

definition-item.definition-title: {for controlling piezoelectric injectors (drive and control circuit for piezoelectric devices in general H10N30/802)}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Drive and control circuit for piezoelectric devices in general

definition-item.definition-title: Safety or indicating devices for abnormal conditions {(in air/fuel ratio feedback systems F02D41/1495, in electric control linkage F02D11/107, in purge control systems F02M25/0809)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Devices and methods for diagnosing the engine or specific components, e.g. actuators or sensors
For the diagnosis, the type of the diagnosed actuator or the diagnosed sensor should be classified as well in the corresponding group, e.g.
F02D41/30 for fuel injectors and F02D41/1444 for exhaust sensors others than air/fuel ratio sensors
This place does not cover:
This group does not cover diagnosis of:

table-column.paragraph-text: Air/fuel ratio feedback systems including air/fuel ratio sensor diagnosis
Exhaust gas treatment systems, e.g. catalytic converters

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Testing of engines on test benches
Testing electrical properties on transport means
Registering data indicating performance e.g. black boxes

definition-item.definition-title: {Addressing techniques specially adapted therefor}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Choice of addressing parameters for parameter retrieval using maps, e.g. rpm, throttle opening and intake pressure, for example

definition-item.definition-title: {One-parameter addressing technique}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Maps with only one input parameter

definition-item.definition-title: {Interpolation techniques}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Use of interpolation for operating points which are grid points of the maps

definition-item.definition-title: {Non-linear variation along at least one coordinate}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Choice of a logarithmic or an inverted value for a parameter to save memory space

definition-item.definition-title: {Selective use of one or more tables}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Choice of different tables according to certain criteria, e.g. fuel type, to combustion modes

definition-item.definition-title: {Methods of calibrating or learning}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Learning of engine, sensor or actuator characteristics, e.g. by learning an additive or multiplicative correction value to displace a complete table or a plurality of points of a complete table depending on the results of the learning.
Learning to consider dispersions between actuators or sensors.
Learning of control values to considers changes of engine, sensor or actuator characteristics due to aging

definition-item.definition-title: {Methods for rewriting}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Rewriting part of the controller memory with new data, e.g. during engine inspections, and associated methods

definition-item.definition-title: {Methods for preventing the loss of data}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Use of (semi-)permanent memories or using permanent batteries to feed normal memories

definition-item.definition-title: {the computer being backed-up or assisted by another circuit, e.g. analogue}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Analog or digital circuits in addition to the main control unit, e.g.

list-item.paragraph-text: a second control unit, e.g. cylinder control units controlling the actuators associated to one cylinder. - watchdog circuits for monitoring the main CPU

definition-item.definition-title: Interface circuits

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Interface circuit between the control unit and associated elements, e.g. multiplexers or signal processing units between sensors and control unit.

definition-item.definition-title: {a mode being the stratified charge spark-ignited mode}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Gasoline engines with a stratified charge, which is usually caused by injection late in the compression stroke and subsequent ignition.
Semi-stratified mode with injections in intake and compression stroke should additionally receive F02D41/402

definition-item.definition-title: {further comprising a homogeneous charge spark-ignited mode}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Engines with stratified and homogeneous modes

definition-item.definition-title: {a mode being the premixed charge compression-ignition mode}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Engine control for engines wherein the mixture is partly or homogeneously premixed and then ignited by compression.
Also called HCCI for homogeneous charge compression ignition.

definition-item.definition-title: {with means for triggering compression ignition, e.g. spark plug}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Means used to trigger the compression-ignition in premixed charge compression ignition engines, e.g.:

list-item.paragraph-text: injection of fluids or gases, e.g. water to delay ignition or pressurized air to create pressure wave- activation of a spark-plug to change the mixture composition- change of compression ratio shortly before TDC- laser ignition aid

definition-item.definition-title: {said means being a secondary injection of fuel}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

A second, small injection shortly before the compression stroke TDC to get local air-fuel ratio above self-ignition limit. Said fuel might also be ignited by spark to cause pressure increase and subsequent self-ignition of the homogeneous mixture
Multiple Injections per se, e.g. with a first injection during the negative valve overlap normally called activation injection, should be classified in F02D41/402

definition-item.definition-title: {the engine working with a variable number of cycles}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Engines controlled to change from 2-cycle to 4-cycle or 6-cycle mode, e.g. by changing valve actuation and injection frequency
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Engine conversions to change number of cycles

definition-item.definition-title: {with special control during transition between modes}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Special measures to avoid problems during combustion mode transitions, e.g. considering the delay between different actuators

definition-item.definition-title: {with special conditions for selecting a mode of combustion, e.g. for starting, for diagnosing}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Conditions other than load/speed map for selecting one of a plurality of combustion modesAdaptation of load/speed maps for selecting combustion modes

definition-item.definition-title: {Control of electrical fuel pumps}

section-body.paragraph-text: Control of electrical low pressure pumps in common rail systems only ass additional information

definition-item.definition-title: of the low pressure type {(F02D41/3082 takes precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Control of fuel injection into intake manifold which is not air-mass based fuel injection control, i.e. essentially air density control after intake pressure and rpm is classified here

definition-item.definition-title: with means for controlling injection timing or duration

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Control of injection duration after air flow
Control of duration after manifold pressure

definition-item.definition-title: with means for controlling distribution

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: of the high pressure type

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
High pressure fuel injection control, e.g. control of fuel amount of electronically controlled direct injectors.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Electronic control of mechanical fuel pumps

definition-item.definition-title: {Controlling the fuel pressure}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Controlling the fuel pressure in the common rail, also setting of target values

definition-item.definition-title: {by controlling the flow into the common rail, e.g. the amount of fuel pumped}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
This includes both diverting the fuel directly from the high pressure pump and the control of fuel amount directed to the pump inlet via the so-called suction control valves

definition-item.definition-title: {with elements in the low pressure part, e.g. low pressure pump}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

The amount of fuel supplied to the high pressure pump is (indirectly) controlled using the low pressure fuel pump, fuel pressure regulators in the low pressure part of the common rail system or other elements in the low pressure circuit
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Suction control valve in the pump inlet

definition-item.definition-title: {by controlling the flow out of the common rail, e.g. using pressure relief valves}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Common rail pressure control via pressure relief valves.

definition-item.definition-title: {characterised by leakage flow in injectors}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Short actuations of the injector which cause some fuel to leak out of the injector and return to the fuel tank. These actuations are usually too short to cause fuel injector opening and therefore supply of fuel to engine.

definition-item.definition-title: {of the in-line type}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Fuel amount control in in-line injection pumps

definition-item.definition-title: {of the distributing type}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Fuel amount control in distributor injector pumps

definition-item.definition-title: Conjoint electrical control of two or more functions, e.g. ignition, fuel-air mixture, recirculation, supercharging or exhaust-gas treatment

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Electrical control of exhaust gas treating apparatus per se

section-body.paragraph-text: This group covers only conjoint electrical control in which the control of air amount follows the control of fuel amount. Any other conjoint electrical control is not to be classified in F02D43/00 and its subgroups but in the respective subgroups of F02D41/00. For example, conjoint control of intake air and fuel injection, where the air control does not follow the fuel control, is covered by groups F02D41/0002 and F02D41/30 or their respective sub-groups.
